fields.title: 2016 Hearthstone World Championship
fields.format: Groups and Playoffs from Quaterfinals. All matches Bo7.

fields.title: HCT Summer Championship 2017
fields.about: The Hearthstone Championship Tour (HCT) Summer Championship is the last seasonal championship of HCT 2017, and it’s poised to be epic. Sixteen players from around the globe will converge on the Blizzard Arena Los Angeles to vie for their share of a $250,000 USD prize pool, as well as one of four spots at the HCT World Championship.
fields.format:
The Summer Championship will have a dual tournament group stage, followed by a single elimination playoff bracket. Groups will consist of four competitors—one from each region. Each match will be best-of-five in the Conquest format with one class ban, so all players need four decks.

Groups will be seeded based on Hearthstone Competitive Points, with the first place player from each region placed in their own group. The groups will then be filled in with the second, third, and fourth place players from each region. No region will be represented more than once in each group.

fields.title: HCT Spring Championship 2017
fields.format: The 2017 Hearthstone Championship Tour's second Championship stop lands amongst the glittering skyline of Shanghai. Sixteen players from around the globe have earned their spot in the HCT Spring Championship to compete for their share of the $250,000 prize pool and a seat at the Hearthstone World Championship. Four groups of four players (one from each region) will compete in a dual-tournament format until only eight remain, at which point the competition will shift to a single-elimination bracket. All matches will be played in a conquest format with a ban.

fields.title: HCT Winter Championship 2017
fields.about: The 2017 Hearthstone Championship Tour's first Championship stop lands on the sunny shores of the Bahamas. Sixteen players from around the globe have earned their spot in the HCT Winter Championship to compete for their share of the $250,000 prize pool and a seat at the Hearthstone World Championship. Four groups of four players (one from each region) will compete in a dual-tournament format until only eight remain, at which point the competition will shift to a single-elimination bracket. All matches will be played in a conquest format with a ban.

fields.title: HCT Europe Summer Championship 2016
fields.about: The HCT Europe Summer Championship is the Seasonal final for the Europe Region. The top 8 players from the HCT Europe Summer Preliminary compete for $100,000 in prize money and the winner is invited to the Hearthstone World Championship at BlizzCon 2016!

fields.title: HCT Americas Summer Championship 2016
fields.about: The HCT Americas Summer Championship is the Seasonal final for the Americas Region. The top 8 players from the HCT Americas Summer Preliminary compete for $100,000 in prize money and the winner is invited to the Hearthstone World Championship at BlizzCon 2016!

fields.title: HCT Asia-Pacific Summer Championship 2016
fields.about: The HCT Asia-Pacific Summer Championship is the Seasonal final for the Asia-Pacific Region. The top 8 players from the HCT Asia-Pacific Summer Preliminary compete for $100,000 in prize money and the winner is invited to the Hearthstone World Championship at BlizzCon 2016!

fields.title: HCT Europe Last Call 2016
fields.about: The HCT Europe Last Call is the battle of the top 8 HCT point earning players in Europe in 2016. These 8 players will compete for their invitation to the Hearthstone World Championship at BlizzCon 2016!

fields.title: HCT Asia-Pacific Last Call 2016
fields.about: The HCT Asia-Pacific Last Call is the battle of the top 8 HCT point earning players in Europe in 2016. These 8 players will compete for their invitation to the Hearthstone World Championship at BlizzCon 2016!

fields.title: HCT Americas Last Call 2016
fields.about: The HCT Americas Last Call is the battle of the top 8 HCT point earning players in the Americas in 2016. These 8 players will compete for their invitation to the Hearthstone World Championship at BlizzCon 2016!

fields.title: HCT Europe Spring Championship 2016
fields.about: The Hearthstone Championship Tour's Spring Season will come to an epic conclusion with the crowning of the Spring Champions! Across three consecutive weekends in June, we will host the Europe, Asia-Pacific, and Americas Spring Championships taking place at the Hollywood Riviera Studios in Torrance, California. Each weekend, the eight qualifying players from their respective region’s Preliminary event will be flown in to battle it out and stake their claim as that region’s Spring Champion. The winners will also earn a spot at this year’s Hearthstone World Championship at BlizzCon, and earn a share of each Championship’s $100,000 USD prize pool!
fields.format:
Format: Best of 7 Conquest format, 5 classes 1 ban.
Brackets: Single Elimination.

fields.title: HCT Asia-Pacific Spring Championship 2016
fields.about: The Hearthstone Championship Tour's Spring Season will come to an epic conclusion with the crowning of the Spring Champions! Across three consecutive weekends in June, we will host the Europe, Asia-Pacific, and Americas Spring Championships taking place at the Hollywood Riviera Studios in Torrance, California. Each weekend, the eight qualifying players from their respective region’s Preliminary event will be flown in to battle it out and stake their claim as that region’s Spring Champion. The winners will also earn a spot at this year’s Hearthstone World Championship at BlizzCon, and earn a share of each Championship’s $100,000 USD prize pool!
fields.format:
Best of 7 Conquest format, 5 classes 1 ban.

fields.title: HCT Americas Spring Championship 2016
fields.about: The Hearthstone Championship Tour's Spring Season will come to an epic conclusion with the crowning of the Spring Champions! Across three consecutive weekends in June, we will host the Europe, Asia-Pacific, and Americas Spring Championships taking place at the Hollywood Riviera Studios in Torrance, California. Each weekend, the eight qualifying players from their respective region’s Preliminary event will be flown in to battle it out and stake their claim as that region’s Spring Champion. The winners will also earn a spot at this year’s Hearthstone World Championship at BlizzCon, and earn a share of each Championship’s $100,000 USD prize pool!
fields.format: Single elimination, best of 7, conquest, bring 5 classes/decks, ban 1.

fields.title: HCT Europe Winter Championship 2016
fields.about: The top 8 qualifying players from Europe will compete for the $100.000 prize pool, and a spot at the $1.000.000 Hearthstone World Championship.
fields.format: Best of 5 Conquest format, 4 classes 1 ban.

fields.title: HCT Americas Winter Championship 2016
fields.about: The top 8 qualifying players from the Americas region will compete for their share of the $100.000 prize pool, and more importantly, a spot at the $1.000.000 Hearthstone World Championships.
fields.format:
Best of 5 Conquest format, 4 classes 1 ban.
Groups: Two groups of four players each in a Double Elimination group stage, top 2 players from each group move on to a Single Elimination bracket.

fields.title: HCT World Championship 2017
fields.about: The 2017 Hearthstone Championship Tour (HCT) World Championship is finally upon us. The crown jewel of the Year of the Mammoth, the World Championship will be the HCT 2017’s swansong. Set to take place in Amsterdam, 16 players—the best of each seasonal championship, and the Last Call qualifiers from every region—come together for the highest glory in competitive Hearthstone.
fields.format:
The World Championship will have a dual tournament group stage, followed by a single elimination playoff bracket. The top two players from each group will advance to the playoff bracket.

Each group will consist of four competitors—one from each of the Seasonal Championships plus Last Call—and have been seeded based on the players results from those Seasonal Championships plus their Hearthstone Competitive Points. Each match will be best-of-five in Conquest format with one class ban, so all players will need four decks.

fields.name: Flame Lance
fields.text: Deal $8 damage to a minion.
fields.flavortext: It's on the rack next to ice lance, acid lance, and English muffin lance.

fields.name: Effigy
fields.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, summon a random minion with the same Cost.
fields.flavortext: Burning man, brah.

fields.name: Fallen Hero
fields.text: Your Hero Power deals 1 extra damage.
fields.flavortext: And he can't get up.

fields.name: Arcane Blast
fields.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. This spell gets double bonus from Spell Damage.
fields.flavortext: Now with 100% more blast!

fields.name: Polymorph: Boar
fields.text: Transform a minion into a 4/2 Boar with Charge.
fields.flavortext: It's always Huffer.

fields.name: Dalaran Aspirant
fields.text: Inspire: Gain Spell Damage +1.
fields.flavortext: Is he aspiring or inspiring?  Make up your mind!

fields.name: Spellslinger
fields.text: Battlecry: Add a random spell to each player's hand.
fields.flavortext: Does he sling spells, or do his spells linger about.  Who can say?

fields.name: Coldarra Drake
fields.text: You can use your Hero Power any number of times.
fields.flavortext: The Grand Tournament has a "No dragons allowed" policy, but it's rarely enforced.

fields.name: Rhonin
fields.text: Deathrattle: Add 3 copies of Arcane Missiles to your hand.
fields.flavortext: A masterless shamurai.

fields.name: Ram Wrangler
fields.text: Battlecry: If you have a Beast, summon a random Beast.
fields.flavortext: Not getting trampled is really the trick here.

fields.name: Holy Champion
fields.text: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.
fields.flavortext: She really likes seeing people get better.  That's why she hurts them in the first place.

fields.name: Spawn of Shadows
fields.text: Inspire: Deal 4 damage to each hero.
fields.flavortext: What did you expect to happen?  He's a Spawn.  Of Shadows.

fields.name: Power Word: Glory
fields.text:
Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, restore 4 Health to
your hero.
fields.flavortext: The promise of glory is a powerful tool to get minions to do your bidding.  Only slightly less powerful than the promise of an ice cream bar!

fields.name: Shadowfiend
fields.text: Whenever you draw a card, reduce its Cost by (1).
fields.flavortext: Hopes to be promoted to "Shadowfriend" someday.

fields.name: Convert
fields.text: Put a copy of an enemy minion into your hand.
fields.flavortext: "Are you interested in... HEALTH benefits?!"

fields.name: Confuse
fields.text: Swap the Attack and Health of all minions.
fields.flavortext: This minion is really powerful!

fields.name: Twilight Guardian
fields.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.
fields.flavortext: A result of magical experiments carried out by the Black Dragonflight, it's not his fault that he's a vicious killer.

fields.name: Confessor Paletress
fields.text: Inspire: Summon a random Legendary minion.
fields.flavortext: She sees into your past and makes you face your fears.  Most common fear:  Getting Majordomo out of Sneed's Old Shredder.

fields.name: Dreadsteed
fields.text: Deathrattle: At the end of the turn, summon a Dreadsteed.
fields.flavortext: Crescendo himself summoned this steed, riding it to victory in the Grand Tournament.  Wherever he rides, an army of riders ride behind him, supporting the legendary champion.

fields.name: Fearsome Doomguard
fields.text: NOINFO
fields.flavortext: They were originally called Cuddleguards, but they were not inspiring the proper amount of fear.

fields.name: Tiny Knight of Evil
fields.text: Whenever you discard a card, gain +1/+1.
fields.flavortext: "No, no, no. I asked for a tiny JESTER of evil."

fields.name: Fist of Jaraxxus
fields.text: When you play or discard this, deal $4 damage to a random enemy.
fields.flavortext: * Not actually Jaraxxus' fist.

fields.name: Void Crusher
fields.text: Inspire: Destroy a random minion for each player.
fields.flavortext: We like to call him "Wesley".

fields.name: Demonfuse
fields.text: Give a Demon +3/+3. Give your opponent a Mana Crystal.
fields.flavortext: Very dangerous when attached to a demonbomb.

fields.name: Dark Bargain

fields.flavortext: A prime example of lose-lose negotiating.

fields.name: Wrathguard

fields.flavortext: After playing against 5 Annoy-O-Trons, any normal guard will become a Wrathguard.

fields.name: Wilfred Fizzlebang
fields.text: Cards you draw from your Hero Power cost (0).
fields.flavortext:
He can summon anything, even a FEARSOME DOOMGUARD*.
*He's pretty sure this is going to work out.

fields.name: Shado-Pan Rider
fields.text: Combo: Gain +3 Attack.
fields.flavortext: He needed a break after that business in the Vale of Eternal Blossoms. Naturally, he chose to spend his vacation in an icy snowscape killing monsters.

fields.name: Buccaneer
fields.text: Whenever you equip a weapon, give it +1 Attack.
fields.flavortext: The best part of buccaneering is the pants.

fields.name: Undercity Valiant
fields.text: Combo: Deal 1 damage.
fields.flavortext: Almost went to play for Stormwind before signing with Undercity.

fields.name: Cutpurse

fields.name: Shady Dealer

fields.name: Burgle

fields.name: Poisoned Blade

fields.name: Beneath the Grounds

fields.flavortext: Can you hold these eggs for just a second?  I promise they're not full of giant enraged undead spider things.

fields.name: Anub'arak

fields.name: Living Roots

fields.name: Savage Combatant

fields.flavortext: Maybe if you whistle a tune it will soothe him.  Yeah...  Try that.

fields.name: Wildwalker
fields.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast +3 Health.
fields.flavortext: She was born to be something.  She is just not quite sure what yet...

fields.name: Knight of the Wild
fields.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, reduce the Cost of this card by (1).
fields.flavortext: He gets a discount on the tournament entry fee because he is his own horse.

fields.name: Druid of the Saber
fields.flavortext: That's saberTEETH, not like curved pirate blades.  That's a different kind of druid.  Druid of the Curved Pirate Blades.

fields.name: Astral Communion
fields.text: Gain 10 Mana Crystals. Discard your hand.

fields.name: Mulch
fields.text:
Destroy a minion.
Add a random minion to your opponent's hand.

fields.name: Aviana
fields.text: Your minions cost (1).

fields.flavortext: Favored by shaman who study the art of restoration and healing, this spell would feel smug, if it had feelings.

fields.name: Thunder Bluff Valiant
fields.text: Inspire: Give your Totems +2 Attack.
fields.flavortext: Allowing totems to attack is not cheating.  I mean, there isn't anything in the rule books about it.

fields.name: Charged Hammer
fields.text: Deathrattle: Your Hero Power becomes 'Deal 2 damage.'
fields.flavortext: You can only pick it up if you are worthy.

fields.name: Elemental Destruction

fields.name: Totem Golem
fields.text: Overload: (1)

fields.name: Ancestral Knowledge
fields.text: Draw 2 cards. Overload: (2)

fields.name: The Mistcaller

fields.name: Flash Heal

fields.name: Powershot

fields.flavortext: pow POW pow

fields.name: Lock and Load

Rexxar narrowed his eyes, grabbed his machine gun, and said: "It's go time.  Lock and load."
This card pays homage to that special moment.

fields.name: Bash

Also damages the minions next to whomever

fields.flavortext: Good fencers make good neighbors, right?

fields.name: Wyrmrest Agent
fields.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.
fields.flavortext: Keeping tabs on the Grand Tournament is priority #1 for the five mighty Dragonflights!

fields.name: Master of Ceremonies
fields.text: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Spell Damage, gain +2/+2.
fields.flavortext: Goes by "MC ElfyElf".

fields.name: Grand Crusader
fields.text: Battlecry: Add a random Paladin card to your hand.
fields.flavortext: A veteran of a number of crusades, she is a force for light and goodness.  Her latest crusade is against goblin telemarketers.

fields.name: Kvaldir Raider
fields.text: Inspire: Gain +2/+2.
fields.flavortext: Coming soon... to a tuskarr village near you!

fields.name: Frost Giant
fields.text: Costs (1) less for each time you used your Hero Power this game.
fields.flavortext: Don't ask him about the beard.  JUST DON'T.

fields.name: Crowd Favorite
fields.text: Whenever you play a card with Battlecry, gain +1/+1.
fields.flavortext: The crowd ALWAYS yells lethal.

fields.name: Gormok the Impaler
fields.text: Battlecry: If you have at least 4 other minions, deal 4 damage.
fields.flavortext: Gormok has been giving impaling lessons in a small tent near the tournament grounds.  For only 25g you too could learn the fine art of impaling!

fields.name: Chillmaw
fields.text: [x]Taunt Deathrattle: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 3 damage to all minions.
fields.flavortext: Chillmaw keeps trying to ruin the Grand Tournament, and she would've done it too, if it weren't for those dang kids!

fields.name: Bolf Ramshield
fields.text: Whenever your hero takes damage, this minion takes it instead.
fields.flavortext: Bolf keeps coming in 2nd at the Grand Tournament.  It might be his year this year, if Lebron doesn't enter.

fields.name: Icehowl
fields.text: Charge Can't attack heroes.
fields.flavortext: This massive yeti just closes his eyes and charges at the nearest target.  The nearest Target is a couple blocks away and has sick deals on skateboards.

fields.name: Nexus-Champion Saraad
fields.text: Inspire: Add a random spell to your hand.
fields.flavortext: The ethereals have their own jousting tournament, and Saraad is the reigning champion.  Also he won the ethereal hot dog eating contest.

fields.name: The Skeleton Knight
fields.text: Deathrattle: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, return this to your hand.
fields.flavortext: Apparently it really was just a flesh wound.

fields.name: Fjola Lightbane
fields.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, gain Divine Shield.
fields.flavortext: LOVES being called "the wonder twins".

fields.name: Sea Reaver
fields.text: When you draw this, deal 1 damage to your minions.
fields.flavortext: A little better than Sea Minus Reaver.

fields.name: Eydis Darkbane
fields.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, deal 3 damage to a random enemy.
fields.flavortext: HATES being called "the wonder twins".

fields.name: Justicar Trueheart
fields.text: Battlecry: Replace your starting Hero Power with a better one.
fields.flavortext: It's like putting racing stripes and a giant spoiler on your hero power.

fields.name: Gadgetzan Jouster
fields.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain +1/+1.
fields.flavortext: It's not HER fault you didn't put a spinning saw blade on your horse.

fields.name: Solemn Vigil
fields.text: Draw 2 cards. Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
fields.flavortext: Each year, folk gather in front of Blackrock Mountain to mourn those who were mind-controlled into the lava.

fields.name: Flamewaker
fields.text: After you cast a spell, deal 2 damage randomly split among all enemies.
fields.flavortext: Flamewakers HATE being confused for Flamewalkers. They just wake up fire, they don’t walk on it. Walking on fire is CRAZY.

fields.name: Dragon's Breath
fields.text: Deal $4 damage. Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
fields.flavortext: Dragons breathe fire, sure, but did you know they can also breathe Cotton Candy?  It's harder to give them a reason to do that, though.

fields.name: Twilight Whelp
fields.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +2 Health.
fields.flavortext: The twilight whelps are basically magic-vampires. Despite this, they are not a reference to any popular series of novels.

fields.name: Demonwrath
fields.text:
[x]Deal $2 damage to all
minions except Demons.
fields.flavortext: Demons are not angry most of the time. You have to play this card in order to really bring it out of them.

fields.name: Imp Gang Boss
fields.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, summon a 1/1 Imp.
fields.flavortext: His imp gang likes to sneak into Stormwind to spraypaint "Ragnaros Rulez" on the Mage Tower.

fields.name: Gang Up
fields.text: Choose a minion. Shuffle 3 copies of it into your deck.
fields.flavortext: If you are thinking about visiting Moonbrook, you better roll deep.

fields.name: Dark Iron Skulker
fields.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all undamaged enemy minions.
fields.flavortext: He loves skulking. He skulks after hours just for the joy of it, but his friends are pretty worried he'll get burnt out.

fields.name: Volcanic Lumberer
fields.text: Taunt Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
fields.flavortext: The roots, the roots, the roots is on fire!

fields.name: Druid of the Flame
fields.text: Choose One - Transform into a 5/2 minion; or a 2/5 minion.
fields.flavortext: Druids who fought too long in Northrend were easily seduced by Ragnaros; a mug of hot chocolate was generally all it took.

fields.name: Lava Shock
fields.text: Deal $2 damage. Unlock your Overloaded Mana Crystals.
fields.flavortext: Chocolate lava cake is shockingly delicious.

fields.name: Fireguard Destroyer
fields.text: Battlecry: Gain 1-4 Attack. Overload: (1)
fields.flavortext: Ragnaros interviews hundreds of Fire Elementals for the position of "Destroyer" but very few have what it takes.

fields.name: Quick Shot
fields.text:
Deal $3 damage.
If your hand is empty, draw a card.
fields.flavortext: Han shot first.

fields.name: Core Rager
fields.text: Battlecry: If your hand is empty, gain +3/+3.
fields.flavortext: It takes a special kind of hunter to venture deep into a firey lava pit and convince a monster who lives there to come home and be a cuddly housepet.

fields.name: Revenge
fields.text: Deal $1 damage to all minions. If you have 12 or less Health, deal $3 damage instead.
fields.flavortext: This is better than Arcane Explosion, so I guess warriors are finally getting revenge on mages for Mortal Strike being worse than Fireball.

fields.name: Axe Flinger
fields.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.
fields.flavortext: Once a lowly "Stick Flinger", he's been relentless on the path to his ultimate dream: "Tauren Flinger".

fields.name: Resurrect
fields.text: Summon a random friendly minion that died this game.
fields.flavortext: I walked into the dungeon and noticed a slain adventurer. In his final moments, he had scrawled out a message in the dust on the wall beside him. Two words: "rez plz"

fields.name: Dragon Consort
fields.text: Battlecry: The next Dragon you play costs (2) less.
fields.flavortext: Everybody wants someone to snuggle with. Even giant armored scaly draconic beasts of destruction.

fields.name: Grim Patron
fields.text: Whenever this minion survives damage, summon another Grim Patron.
fields.flavortext: If you love getting your face punched, come to the Grim Guzzler!

fields.name: Dragonkin Sorcerer
fields.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, gain +1/+1.
fields.flavortext: Dragonkin Sorcerers be all "I'm a wizard" and everyone else be all "daaaaang".

fields.name: Dragon Egg
fields.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, summon a 2/1 Whelp.
fields.flavortext: Think of them as bullets for your dragon gun.

fields.name: Drakonid Crusher
fields.text: Battlecry: If your opponent has 15 or less Health, gain +3/+3.
fields.flavortext: Drakonids were created to have all the bad parts of a dragon in the form of a humanoid. But, like, why?

fields.name: Volcanic Drake
fields.text: Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
fields.flavortext: Volcanic Drakes breathe lava instead of fire. The antacid vendor at Thorium Point does a brisk business with them.

fields.name: Hungry Dragon
fields.text: Battlecry: Summon a random 1-Cost minion for your opponent.
fields.flavortext: Hungry Hungry Dragon is NOT a fun game.

fields.name: Majordomo Executus
fields.text: Deathrattle: Replace your hero with Ragnaros, the Firelord.
fields.flavortext: You thought Executus turned you into Ragnaros, but really Ragnaros was in you the whole time.

fields.name: Emperor Thaurissan
fields.text: At the end of your turn, reduce the Cost of cards in your hand by (1).
fields.flavortext: His second greatest regret is summoning an evil Firelord who enslaved his entire people.

fields.name: Rend Blackhand
fields.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, destroy a Legendary minion.
fields.flavortext: Rend believes he is the True Warchief of the Horde and he keeps editing the wikipedia page for "Warchief of the Horde" to include his picture.

fields.name: Nefarian
fields.text: Battlecry: Add 2 random spells to your hand (from your opponent's class).
fields.flavortext: They call him "Blackwing" because he's a black dragon...... and he's got wings.

fields.name: Chromaggus
fields.text: Whenever you draw a card, put another copy into your hand.
fields.flavortext: Left head and right head can never agree about what to eat for dinner, so they always end up just eating ramen again.

fields.name: Blackwing Technician
fields.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1/+1.
fields.flavortext: This is who you go to when your Blackwing needs a tune up. Don't go to a cut rate Blackwing tune up shop!

fields.name: Blackwing Corruptor
fields.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 3 damage.
fields.flavortext: He got his name when he gave Blackwing some comic books and rock & roll records.

fields.name: Raza the Chained
fields.text: [x] Battlecry: If your deck has no duplicates, your Hero Power costs (0) this game.
fields.flavortext: "Could you do me a favor and get the keys from Kazakus?"

fields.name: Freezing Potion
fields.text: Freeze an enemy.
fields.flavortext: This is delicious! Oh no. BRAIN FREEEEEEEZE!

fields.name: Wind-up Burglebot
fields.text: Whenever this attacks a minion and survives, draw_a card.
fields.flavortext: Don't blame the bot for his crimes...  Blame whoever keeps winding him up!

fields.name: Hidden Cache
fields.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, give a random minion in your hand +2/+2.
fields.flavortext: There is an urban legend that the first Toxic Sewer Ooze was born because a rookie Goon stashed an open container of milk in a Hidden Cache.

fields.name: Street Trickster
fields.text: Spell Damage +1
fields.flavortext: His first trick: making your wallet disappear!

fields.name: Red Mana Wyrm
fields.text: Whenever  you cast a spell, gain +2 Attack.
fields.flavortext: It has double the Attack.  "Go on."  And double the Health.  "Yes??"  And its trigger has twice the effect.  "WHAT???"  And it costs…  Five times more.

fields.name: Jinyu Waterspeaker
fields.text: [x]Battlecry: Restore 6 Health. Overload: (1)
fields.flavortext: Waterspeakers can tell the future! So the Jade Lotus employs them to speculate on the Auction House.

fields.name: Grimestreet Protector
fields.text: [x]Taunt Battlecry: Give adjacent _minions Divine Shield.
fields.flavortext: Some new asphalt should do the trick.

fields.name: Kooky Chemist
fields.text: Battlecry: Swap the Attack and Health of a minion.
fields.flavortext: #abs

fields.name: Blubber Baron
fields.text: Whenever you summon a Battlecry minion while this_is in your hand, gain_+1/+1.
fields.flavortext: When oil, railroad, steel, robber, and red are all already taken, your options are limited.

fields.name: Volcanic Potion
fields.text: Deal $2 damage to all_minions.
fields.flavortext: The secret ingredient in Kazakus's award-winning chili recipe.

fields.name: Kabal Lackey
fields.text: [x]Battlecry: The next Secret you play this turn costs (0).
fields.flavortext: I'll tell you one thing he doesn't lack: GUMPTION.

fields.name: Hozen Healer
fields.text: Battlecry: Restore a minion to full Health.
fields.flavortext: He didn't go to school for healing, but we keep losing all the good healers to Ratchet, so I guess we'll take him.

fields.name: Felfire Potion
fields.text: Deal $5 damage to all characters.
fields.flavortext: Kazakus has a squad of imps bottling Felfire round-the-clock and he *still* can't keep up with demand.

fields.name: Weasel Tunneler
fields.text: Deathrattle: Shuffle this minion into your opponent's deck.
fields.flavortext: He's the reason the First Bank of Gadgetzan has steel floors.

fields.name: Mistress of Mixtures
fields.text: Deathrattle: Restore 4 Health to each hero.
fields.flavortext: Her favorite mixture is cola and lime.

fields.name: Public Defender
fields.text: Taunt
fields.flavortext: Happy to defend any public offender!

fields.name: Smuggler's Run
fields.text: Give all minions in your hand +1/+1.
fields.flavortext: One of the most famous busts in Gadgetzan’s history happened on Smuggler’s Run, where Sergeant Sally apprehended a cadre of Grimy Goons transporting a massive number of illegal fish heads.

fields.name: Kun the Forgotten King
fields.text: Choose One - Gain 10 Armor; or Refresh your Mana Crystals.
fields.flavortext: Aya siphons a bit of Kun's soul to animate each golem in her Jade army. To his credit, he's being a great sport about it.

fields.name: Call in the Finishers
fields.text: Summon four 1/1 Murlocs.
fields.flavortext: When you really need a job done… but you don't really care if it gets done right.

fields.name: Jade Chieftain
fields.text: Battlecry: Summon a{1} {0} Jade Golem. Give it Taunt. @Battlecry: Summon a Jade Golem. Give it Taunt.
fields.flavortext: Seeing his Jade Golem grow up into the tall, handsome 6/6 standing before him was the proudest moment of his life.

fields.name: Finders Keepers
fields.text: Discover a card with_Overload. Overload: (1)
fields.flavortext: INFINITE LOOP!

fields.name: Alleycat
fields.text: Battlecry: Summon a 1/1_Cat.
fields.flavortext: To be a cool cat in Gadgetzan, you gotta have bling.

fields.name: Rat Pack
fields.text: [x]Deathrattle: Summon a number of 1/1 Rats equal _to this minion's Attack.
fields.flavortext: He's gonna do it his way.

fields.name: Grimestreet Informant
fields.text: [x]Battlecry: Discover a Hunter, Paladin, or Warrior card.
fields.flavortext: "Naw, naw.  You're talkin' about Grime BOULEVARD.  I ain't know nuthin' 'bout that."

fields.name: White Eyes
fields.text: Taunt Deathrattle: Shuffle 'The Storm Guardian' into your deck.
fields.flavortext: My life for Aya!

fields.name: Small-Time Buccaneer
fields.text: Has +2 Attack while you have a weapon equipped.
fields.flavortext: "Oh, I'm not serious about it.  I only pirate on the weekends."

fields.name: Fight Promoter
fields.text: [x]Battlecry: If you control a minion with 6 or more _Health, draw two cards.
fields.flavortext: "Yeah, I can get you Knuckles.  No, no, he's been clean for *weeks*."

fields.name: Knuckles
fields.text:
After this attacks a
minion, it also hits the enemy hero.
fields.flavortext: When confronted with accusations of performance-enhancing bananas, Knuckles replied, "I get my fruit from trees I knock down with my bare hands like everyone else."

fields.name: Smuggler's Crate
fields.text: Give a random Beast in your hand +2/+2.
fields.flavortext: Are you sure these are the crates that are supposed to go to the Gadgetzan petting zoo?

fields.name: Dispatch Kodo
fields.text: Battlecry: Deal damage equal to this minion's Attack.
fields.flavortext: "Crime reported at First Bank of Gadgetzan.  Huge quantities of Jade being carried away by what looks like a bunch of Hozen.  Kodo 77 can you make it over there now?"

fields.name: Shaky Zipgunner
fields.text: [x]Deathrattle: Give a random minion in your hand +2/+2.
fields.flavortext: The Grimy Goons can get you any weapon you want but if you want it to not explode you gotta pay extra.

fields.name: Piranha Launcher
fields.text:
[x]After your hero attacks,
summon a 1/1 Piranha.
fields.flavortext: A great improvement over the guppy launcher.

fields.name: Trogg Beastrager
fields.text: Battlecry: Give a random Beast in your hand +1/+1.
fields.flavortext: Still angry that the Gadgetzan Rager Club wouldn't accept him as a member.

fields.name: Sergeant Sally
fields.text: Deathrattle: Deal damage equal to this minion's Attack to all enemy minions.
fields.flavortext: "Who is she?  Where did she come from?  We don't even have a police force here in Gadgetzan!!" - Mayor Noggenfogger

fields.name: Luckydo Buccaneer
fields.text: Battlecry: If your weapon has at least 3 Attack, gain +4/+4.
fields.flavortext: You can't just leave a Luckydo somewhere.  You gotta keep 'em with you!  Especially in Gadgetzan!

fields.name: Jade Behemoth
fields.text: [x]Taunt Battlecry: Summon a{1} {0} Jade Golem.@[x]Taunt Battlecry: Summon a Jade Golem.
fields.flavortext: I think we should talk about the jade elephant in the room.

fields.name: Finja, the Flying Star
fields.text: [x]Stealth Whenever this attacks and kills a minion, summon 2 _Murlocs from your deck.
fields.flavortext: The last true master of Finjitsu.

fields.name: Jade Idol
fields.text: Choose One - Summon a{1} {0} Jade Golem; or Shuffle 3 copies of this card into your deck.@Choose One - Summon a Jade Golem; or Shuffle 3 copies of this card into your deck.
fields.flavortext: Shuffle or no guts.

fields.name: Potion of Madness
fields.text: Gain control of an enemy minion with 2 or less Attack until end of turn.
fields.flavortext: You'd be insane NOT to drink it!

fields.name: Greater Healing Potion
fields.text: Restore #12 Health to a friendly character.
fields.flavortext: Filled with electrolytes!

fields.name: Drakonid Operative
fields.text: [x]Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, Discover a card in _your opponent's deck.
fields.flavortext: His job is to spy on the Goons and the Jade Lotus, but he's OBVIOUSLY a dragon so it's pretty hard work.

fields.name: Mana Geode
fields.text: Whenever this minion is_healed, summon a 2/2_Crystal.
fields.flavortext: Gadgetzan, where even the pet rocks have pet rocks.

fields.name: Blastcrystal Potion
fields.text: Destroy a minion and one of your Mana Crystals.
fields.flavortext: There's a fine line between "potion" and "grenade". Wait. Actually, there's not.

fields.name: Fel Orc Soulfiend
fields.text: At the start of your turn, deal 2 damage to this_minion.
fields.flavortext: "Doc says the persistent burning sensation in my soul is probably just an ulcer."

fields.name: Crystalweaver
fields.text: Battlecry: Give your Demons +1/+1.
fields.flavortext: The trick is soaking the crystals in warm milk to soften them up.

fields.name: Bloodfury Potion
fields.text:
[x]Give a minion +3 Attack.
If it's a Demon, also
give it +3 Health.
fields.flavortext: You know what really makes my blood boil? The skyrocketing price of Bloodfury potions!

fields.name: Mark of the Lotus
fields.text: Give your minions +1/+1.
fields.flavortext: The mark of the Lotus is a little flower drawn in permanent marker on the ankle.

fields.name: Pilfered Power
fields.text: Gain an empty Mana Crystal for each friendly minion.
fields.flavortext: The Hozen don't get paid much, but at least they get to keep any excess mana.

fields.name: Celestial Dreamer
fields.text: [x]Battlecry: If you control a minion with 5 or more Attack, gain +2/+2.
fields.flavortext: If you think her job is easy, YOU try falling asleep on cue.

fields.name: Kabal Chemist
fields.text: Battlecry: Add a random Potion to your hand.
fields.flavortext: Sure you could have that Polymorph potion, but wouldn't you rather have this mystery potion?  It could be anything.  Even a Polymorph potion!

fields.name: Potion of Polymorph
fields.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, transform it into a 1/1 Sheep.
fields.flavortext: Tastes like Baaaaananas.

fields.name: Kazakus
fields.text: [x]Battlecry: If your deck has no duplicates, _create a custom spell.
fields.flavortext: The mysterious leader of the Kabal is NOT a dragon, and does NOT deal in illegal potions.  Any public statements to the contrary will be met with litigation and Dragonfire Potions.

fields.name: Greater Arcane Missiles
fields.text: Shoot three missiles at random enemies that deal $3 damage each.
fields.flavortext: Wow, and I thought Arcane Missiles was great!

fields.name: Kabal Talonpriest
fields.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +3 Health.
fields.flavortext: Inkmaster Solia had to figure out how to tattoo feathers.

fields.name: Counterfeit Coin
fields.text: Gain 1 Mana Crystal this turn only.
fields.flavortext: There is something funny about this coin… can't quite put my finger on it…

fields.name: Brass Knuckles
fields.text:
[x]After your hero attacks,
give a random minion in
your hand +1/+1.
fields.flavortext: For the goon that wants to make a fashion statement.

fields.name: Lotus Assassin
fields.text: Stealth. Whenever this attacks and kills a minion, gain Stealth.
fields.flavortext: For 5000g, you can just give the Jade Lotus any name and they will assassinate and/or embarrass them.

fields.name: Shadow Rager
fields.text: Stealth
fields.flavortext: WE WENT THERE!

fields.name: Patches the Pirate
fields.text: [x]Charge After you play a Pirate, summon this minion from your deck.
fields.flavortext: What do sailors yell when Patches steals their treasure chest full of laws and other things being transported to parliament for a vote?  "The Eyes have it!"

fields.name: Grimestreet Enforcer
fields.text: At the end of your turn, give all minions in your hand +1/+1.
fields.flavortext: "Sir, you don't have a permit to park your mount here."

fields.name: Hobart Grapplehammer
fields.text: Battlecry: Give all weapons in your hand and deck +1 Attack.
fields.flavortext: Grapplehammer is the horrible mind behind the Automatic Piranha Launcher (banned in 7 districts)!

fields.name: Backstreet Leper
fields.text: [x]Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.
fields.flavortext: Quit playing games with his heart. And his fingers. And foot. It's rude.

fields.name: Blowgill Sniper
fields.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage.
fields.flavortext: Imagine how much further his darts would go if he had lungs instead of gills!

fields.name: Big-Time Racketeer
fields.text: Battlecry: Summon a 6/6_Ogre.
fields.flavortext: "It'd be a shame if someone disenchanted those Legendaries."

fields.name: Kabal Courier
fields.text: Battlecry: Discover a Mage, Priest, or Warlock card.
fields.flavortext: Hey, you park your kodo under a harpy nest, you get what you deserve.

fields.name: Grimscale Chum
fields.text: [x]Battlecry: Give a random Murloc in your hand +1/+1.
fields.flavortext: Listen, see?  We'll take 'em to the docks, see?  And throw 'em in the sea, see?

fields.name: Naga Corsair
fields.text: Battlecry: Give your weapon +1 Attack.
fields.flavortext: Hook-tails are nice and all but she keeps getting stuck on things.

fields.name: Second-Rate Bruiser
fields.text: [x]Taunt Costs (2) less if your opponent has at least three minions.
fields.flavortext: He'll be a first-rate bruiser once he gets used to his contacts.

fields.name: Hired Gun
fields.text: Taunt
fields.flavortext: He loves his job and would do it for free!  (But don't tell his boss!)

fields.name: Friendly Bartender
fields.text: At the end of your turn, restore 1 Health to your_hero.
fields.flavortext: "What'll it be?  A Jade Brew?  A Grimy Goose?  A Kabal Manatini?"

fields.name: Toxic Sewer Ooze
fields.text: Battlecry: Remove 1 Durability from your opponent's weapon.
fields.flavortext: When Sergeant Sally shows up unexpectedly, DO NOT FLUSH YOUR MANA CRYSTALS DOWN THE TOILET.

fields.name: Streetwise Investigator
fields.text: Battlecry: Enemy minions lose Stealth.
fields.flavortext: "Hmmmm…  Call it a hunch, but I'm starting to think that there may be some kind of criminal activity going on in Gadgetzan."

fields.name: Kabal Songstealer
fields.text: [x]Battlecry: Silence a minion.
fields.flavortext: Gadgetzan Writer’s Award goes to the player who writes the most compelling fanfic about why this Arakkoa has a golden frog in his hand!

fields.name: Backroom Bouncer
fields.text: Whenever a friendly minion dies, gain +1 Attack.
fields.flavortext: "WHY ARE YOU IN THE BACK ROOM?  WHO IS WATCHING THE FRONT?!"

fields.name: Gadgetzan Socialite
fields.text: Battlecry: Restore 2_Health.
fields.flavortext: Comment on her height, and she'll go from flapper to kneecapper in seconds flat.

fields.name: Manic Soulcaster
fields.text: Battlecry: Choose a friendly minion. Shuffle a copy into your deck.
fields.flavortext: When casting a tournament, you really have to put your soul into it!

fields.name: Pint-Size Potion
fields.text:
[x]Give all enemy minions
-3 Attack this turn only.
fields.flavortext: I hope you didn't disenchant your Shadow Word: Horror!

fields.name: Dragonfire Potion
fields.text:
[x]Deal $5 damage to all
minions except Dragons.
fields.flavortext: No one was brave enough to fire the dragon in person… so they made the potion do it.

fields.name: Kabal Trafficker
fields.text:
[x]At the end of your turn,
add a random Demon
to your hand.
fields.flavortext: She ships illicit mana crystals around the world in packages marked: FUNNEL CAKE.

fields.name: Worgen Greaser
fields.text: NOINFO
fields.flavortext: Hair products are 79% of his monthly budget.

fields.name: Grook Fu Master
fields.text: Windfury
fields.flavortext: Grook Fu, the ancient Hozen art of bashing heads with a stick.
