fields.name: Abusive Sergeant
fields.text: Battlecry: Give a minion +2_Attack this turn.
fields.flavortext: ADD ME TO YOUR DECK, MAGGOT!

fields.name: Elven Archer
fields.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage.
fields.flavortext: Don't bother asking her out on a date.  She'll shoot you down.

fields.name: Razorfen Hunter
fields.text: Battlecry: Summon a 1/1_Boar.
fields.flavortext: Someone did mess with Tuskerr once.  ONCE.

fields.name: Ogre Magi
fields.text: Spell Damage +1
fields.flavortext: Training Ogres in the art of spellcasting is a questionable decision.

fields.name: Boulderfist Ogre
fields.text: NOINFO
fields.flavortext: "ME HAVE GOOD STATS FOR THE COST"

fields.name: Core Hound
fields.text: NOINFO
fields.flavortext: You don’t tame a Core Hound. You just train it to eat someone else before it eats you.

fields.name: Ironbeak Owl
fields.text: Battlecry: Silence a_minion.
fields.flavortext: Their wings are silent but their screech is... whatever the opposite of silent is.

fields.name: Reckless Rocketeer
fields.text: Charge
fields.flavortext: One Insane Rocketeer.   One Rocket full of Explosives.   Infinite Fun.

fields.name: Spiteful Smith
fields.text: Enrage: Your weapon has +2 Attack.
fields.flavortext: She'll craft you a sword, but you'll need to bring her 5 Steel Ingots, 3 Motes of Earth, and the scalp of her last customer.

fields.name: Stormwind Champion
fields.text: Your other minions have +1/+1.
fields.flavortext: When Deathwing assaulted the capital, this soldier was the only member of his squad to survive. Now he's all bitter and stuff.

fields.name: Frostwolf Warlord
fields.text: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each other friendly minion on the battlefield.
fields.flavortext: The Frostwolves are locked in combat with the Stormpike Expedition over control of Alterac Valley.  Every attempt at peace-talks has ended with Captain Galvangar killing the mediator.

fields.name: Venture Co. Mercenary
fields.text: Your minions cost (3) more.
fields.flavortext: No Job is too big.  No fee is too big.

fields.name: Wisp
fields.text: NOINFO
fields.flavortext: If you hit an Eredar Lord with enough Wisps, it will explode.   But why?

fields.name: Ironbark Protector
fields.text: Taunt
fields.flavortext: I dare you to attack Darnassus.

fields.name: Blade Flurry
fields.text: Destroy your weapon and deal its damage to all enemy minions.
fields.flavortext: "Look, it's not just about waving daggers around really fast.  It's a lot more complicated than that." - Shan, Rogue Trainer

fields.name: Shadow Word: Pain
fields.text: Destroy a minion with 3_or less Attack.
fields.flavortext: A step up from a spell cast by many beginning acolytes: "Shadow Word: Annoy".

fields.name: Northshire Cleric
fields.text: Whenever a minion is healed, draw a card.
fields.flavortext: They help the downtrodden and distressed.  Also they sell cookies.

fields.name: Divine Spirit
fields.text: Double a minion's Health.
fields.flavortext: Double the trouble. Double the fun!

fields.name: Starving Buzzard
fields.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, draw a card.
fields.flavortext: If you feed him, he loses his whole identity.

fields.name: Darkscale Healer
fields.text: Battlecry: Restore 2 Health to all friendly characters.
fields.flavortext: Healing is just something she does in her free time.  It's more of a hobby really.

fields.name: Houndmaster
fields.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast +2/+2 and Taunt.
fields.flavortext: "Who let the dogs out?" he asks.  It's rhetorical.

fields.name: Timber Wolf
fields.text: Your other Beasts have +1_Attack.
fields.flavortext: Other beasts totally dig hanging out with timber wolves.

fields.name: Tundra Rhino
fields.text: Your Beasts have Charge.
fields.flavortext: Tundra rhinos are often mistaken for kodos.  Or am I mistaken?

fields.name: Multi-Shot
fields.text: Deal $3 damage to two random enemy minions.
fields.flavortext: You see, it's all about throughput.

fields.name: Tracking
fields.text: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. Draw one and discard the_others.
fields.flavortext: For the person who just cannot decide what card to put into a deck!

fields.name: Arcane Shot
fields.text: Deal $2 damage.
fields.flavortext: Magi conjured arcane arrows to sell to hunters, until hunters learned just enough magic to do it themselves.  The resulting loss of jobs sent Stormwind into a minor recession.

fields.name: Gladiator's Longbow
fields.text: Your hero is Immune while attacking.
fields.flavortext: The longbow allows shots to be fired from farther away and is useful for firing on particularly odorous targets.

fields.name: Mind Blast
fields.text: Deal $5 damage to the enemy hero.
fields.flavortext: This spell blasts you directly in the MIND.

fields.name: Lightwarden
fields.text: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.
fields.flavortext: She’s smaller than her sisters Mediumwarden and Heavywarden.

fields.name: The Black Knight
fields.text: Battlecry: Destroy an enemy minion with Taunt.
fields.flavortext: He was sent by the Lich King to disrupt the Argent Tournament.   We can pretty much mark that a failure.

fields.name: Young Priestess
fields.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Health.
fields.flavortext: She can't wait to learn Power Word: Fortitude Rank 2.

fields.name: Big Game Hunter
fields.text: Battlecry: Destroy a minion with 7 or more Attack.
fields.flavortext: Mere devilsaurs no longer excite him.  Soon he'll be trying to catch Onyxia with only a dull Krol Blade.

fields.name: Alarm-o-Bot
fields.text:
[x]At the start of your turn,
swap this minion with a
   random one in your hand.
fields.flavortext: WARNING.  WARNING.  WARNING.

fields.name: Acolyte of Pain
fields.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, draw a_card.
fields.flavortext: He trained when he was younger to be an acolyte of joy, but things didn’t work out like he thought they would.

fields.name: Argent Squire
fields.text: Divine Shield
fields.flavortext: "I solemnly swear to uphold the Light, purge the world of darkness, and to eat only burritos." - The Argent Dawn Oath

fields.name: Angry Chicken
fields.text: Enrage: +5 Attack.
fields.flavortext: There is no beast more frightening (or ridiculous) than a fully enraged chicken.

fields.name: Worgen Infiltrator
fields.text: Stealth
fields.flavortext: If you want to stop a worgen from infiltrating, just yell, "No! Bad boy!"

fields.name: Voodoo Doctor
fields.text: Battlecry: Restore 2_Health.
fields.flavortext: Voodoo is an oft-misunderstood art. But it is art.

fields.name: Bloodmage Thalnos
fields.text: Spell Damage +1. Deathrattle: Draw a card.
fields.flavortext: He's in charge of the Annual Scarlet Monastery Blood Drive!

fields.name: King Mukla
fields.text: Battlecry: Give your opponent 2 Bananas.
fields.flavortext: King Mukla wanders Jaguero Isle, searching for love.

fields.name: Novice Engineer
fields.text: Battlecry: Draw a card.
fields.flavortext: "Half of this class will not graduate… since they'll have been turned to chickens." - Tinkmaster Overspark, teaching Gizmos 101.

fields.name: Sylvanas Windrunner
fields.text: Deathrattle: Take control of a random enemy minion.
fields.flavortext: Sylvanas was turned into the Banshee Queen by Arthas, but he probably should have just killed her because it just pissed her off.

fields.name: Jungle Panther
fields.text: Stealth
fields.flavortext: Stranglethorn is a beautiful place to visit, but you wouldn't want to live there.

fields.name: Shattered Sun Cleric
fields.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +1/+1.
fields.flavortext: They always have a spare flask of Sunwell Energy Drink™!

fields.name: Scarlet Crusader
fields.text: Divine Shield
fields.flavortext: Never wash your whites with a Scarlet Crusader.

fields.name: Thrallmar Farseer
fields.text: Windfury
fields.flavortext: He's stationed in the Hellfire Peninsula, but he's hoping for a reassignment closer to Orgrimmar, or really anywhere the ground is less on fire.

fields.name: Silvermoon Guardian
fields.text: Divine Shield
fields.flavortext: The first time they tried to guard Silvermoon against the scourge, it didn’t go so well…

fields.name: Dragonling Mechanic
fields.text: Battlecry: Summon a 2/1 Mechanical Dragonling.
fields.flavortext: She is still working on installing the rocket launcher add-on for Mr. Bitey.

fields.name: Stranglethorn Tiger
fields.text: Stealth
fields.flavortext: The wonderful thing about tigers is tigers are wonderful things!

fields.name: Leper Gnome
fields.text: Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to the enemy_hero.
fields.flavortext: He really just wants to be your friend, but the constant rejection is starting to really get to him.

fields.name: Sunwalker
fields.text: Taunt Divine Shield
fields.flavortext: She doesn’t ACTUALLY walk on the Sun.  It's just a name.  Don’t worry!

fields.name: Windfury Harpy
fields.text: Windfury
fields.flavortext: Harpies are not pleasant sounding.  That's the nicest I can put it.

fields.name: Twilight Drake
fields.text: Battlecry: Gain +1 Health for each card in your hand.
fields.flavortext: Twilight drakes feed on Mystical Energy.  And Tacos.

fields.name: Questing Adventurer
fields.text: Whenever you play a card, gain +1/+1.
fields.flavortext: "Does anyone have some extra Boar Pelts?"

fields.name: Ancient Watcher
fields.text: Can't attack.
fields.flavortext: Why do its eyes seem to follow you as you walk by?

fields.name: Dark Iron Dwarf
fields.text: Battlecry: Give a minion +2_Attack this turn.
fields.flavortext: Guardians of Dark Iron Ore.  Perhaps the most annoying ore, given where you have to forge it.

fields.name: Spellbreaker
fields.text: Battlecry: Silence a_minion.
fields.flavortext: Spellbreakers can rip enchantments from magic-wielders.  The process is painless and can be performed on an outpatient basis.

fields.name: Youthful Brewmaster
fields.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.
fields.flavortext: His youthful enthusiasm doesn’t always equal excellence in his brews.   Don’t drink the Mogu Stout!

fields.name: Coldlight Oracle
fields.text: Battlecry: Each player draws 2 cards.
fields.flavortext: They can see the future.   In that future both players draw more cards.   Spoooky.

fields.name: Mana Addict
fields.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +2 Attack this turn.
fields.flavortext: She’s trying to kick the habit, but still takes some mana whenever she has a stressful day.

fields.name: Ancient Brewmaster
fields.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.
fields.flavortext: Most pandaren say his brew tastes like yak.  But apparently that's a compliment.

fields.name: Sunfury Protector
fields.text: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions Taunt.
fields.flavortext: She carries a shield, but only so she can give it to someone she can stand behind.

fields.name: Crazed Alchemist
fields.text: Battlecry: Swap the Attack and Health of a minion.
fields.flavortext: "You'll love my new recipe!" he says... especially if you're not happy with your current number of limbs.

fields.name: Old Murk-Eye
fields.text: Charge. Has +1 Attack for each other Murloc on the battlefield.
fields.flavortext: He's a legend among murlocs.  "Mrghllghghllghg!", they say.

fields.name: Acidic Swamp Ooze
fields.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon.
fields.flavortext: Oozes love Flamenco.  Don't ask.

fields.name: Argent Commander
fields.text: Charge Divine Shield
fields.flavortext: The Argent Dawn stands vigilant against the Scourge, as well as people who cut in line at coffee shops.

fields.name: Pint-Sized Summoner
fields.text: The first minion you play each turn costs (1) less.
fields.flavortext: She's quite jealous of the Gallon-Sized Summoner.

fields.name: Secretkeeper
fields.text: Whenever a Secret is played, gain +1/+1.
fields.flavortext: She promises not to tell anyone about that thing you did last night with that one person.

fields.name: Mad Bomber
fields.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage randomly split between all other characters.
fields.flavortext: He's not really all that crazy, he is just not as careful with explosives as he should be.

fields.name: Tinkmaster Overspark
fields.text: [x]Battlecry: Transform another random minion into a 5/5 Devilsaur or a 1/1 Squirrel.
fields.flavortext: Tinkmaster Overspark nearly lost his Tinker's license after the Great Ironforge Squirrel Stampede of '09.

fields.name: Warsong Commander
fields.text: Your Charge minions have +1 Attack.
fields.flavortext: The Warsong clan is such drama. It's really not worth it to become a commander.

fields.name: Mind Control Tech
fields.text: [x]Battlecry: If your opponent has 4 or more minions, take control of one at random.
fields.flavortext: Mind Control technology is getting better, but that's not saying much.

fields.name: Arcane Golem
fields.text: Battlecry: Give your opponent a Mana Crystal.
fields.flavortext: Having Arcane golems at home really classes up the place, and as a bonus they are great conversation pieces.

fields.name: Cabal Shadow Priest
fields.text: Battlecry: Take control of an enemy minion that has 2 or less Attack.
fields.flavortext: You never know who may be secretly working for the Cabal....

fields.name: Defender of Argus
fields.text: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions +1/+1 and Taunt.
fields.flavortext: You wouldn’t think that Argus would need this much defending.  But it does.

fields.name: Gadgetzan Auctioneer
fields.text: Whenever you cast a spell, draw a card.
fields.flavortext: He used to run the black market auction house, but there was just too much violence and he had to move.

fields.name: Loot Hoarder
fields.text: Deathrattle: Draw a card.
fields.flavortext: Always roll need.

fields.name: Abomination
fields.text: Taunt. Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to ALL characters.
fields.flavortext: Abominations enjoy Fresh Meat and long walks on the beach.

fields.name: Lorewalker Cho
fields.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, put a copy into the other player’s hand.
fields.flavortext: Lorewalker Cho archives and shares tales from the land of Pandaria, but his favorite story is the one where Joey and Phoebe go on a road trip.

fields.name: Demolisher
fields.text: At the start of your turn, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.
fields.flavortext: Laying siege isn't fun for anyone.  It's not even all that effective, now that everyone has a flying mount.

fields.name: Coldlight Seer
fields.text: Battlecry: Give your other Murlocs +2 Health.
fields.flavortext: The Coldlight murlocs reside in the darkest pits of the Abyssal Depths.  So no, there's no getting away from murlocs.

fields.name: Mountain Giant
fields.text: Costs (1) less for each other card in your hand.
fields.flavortext: His mother said that he was just big boned.

fields.name: Cairne Bloodhoof
fields.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 4/5 Baine Bloodhoof.
fields.flavortext: Cairne was killed by Garrosh, so... don't put this guy in a Warrior deck.  It's pretty insensitive.

fields.name: Gelbin Mekkatorque
fields.text: Battlecry: Summon an AWESOME invention.
fields.flavortext: He's the leader of the gnomes, and an incredible inventor.  He's getting better, too; He turns things into chickens WAY less than he used to.

fields.name: Leeroy Jenkins
fields.text: Charge. Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Whelps for your opponent.
fields.flavortext: At least he has Angry Chicken.

fields.name: Eviscerate
fields.text: Deal $2 damage. Combo: Deal $4 damage instead.
fields.flavortext: There is a high cost to Eviscerating your opponent:  It takes a long time to get blood stains out of leather armor.

fields.name: Betrayal
fields.text: Force an enemy minion to deal its damage to the minions next to it.
fields.flavortext: Everyone has a price. Gnomes, for example, can be persuaded by stuffed animals and small amounts of chocolate.

fields.name: Conceal
fields.text: Give your minions Stealth until your next_turn.
fields.flavortext: Rogues conceal everything but their emotions.  You can't get 'em to shut up about feelings.

fields.name: Fan of Knives
fields.text: Deal $1 damage to all enemy minions. Draw_a card.
fields.flavortext: I wouldn't say I LOVE knives, but I'm definitely a fan.

fields.name: Noble Sacrifice
fields.text: Secret: When an enemy attacks, summon a 2/1 Defender as the new target.
fields.flavortext: We will always remember you, "Defender!"

fields.name: Defias Ringleader
fields.text: Combo: Summon a 2/1 Defias Bandit.
fields.flavortext: He stole the deed to town years ago, so technically the town is his. He just calls people Scrub to be mean.

fields.name: Eye for an Eye
fields.text: Secret: When your hero takes damage, deal_that much damage to the enemy hero.
fields.flavortext: Justice sometimes takes the form of a closed fist into a soft cheek.

fields.name: Perdition's Blade
fields.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage. Combo: Deal 2 instead.
fields.flavortext: Perdition's Blade is Ragnaros's back-up weapon while Sulfuras is in the shop.

fields.name: SI:7 Agent
fields.text: Combo: Deal 2 damage.
fields.flavortext: The agents of SI:7 are responsible for Stormwind's covert activities.  Their duties include espionage, assassination, and throwing surprise birthday parties for the royal family.

fields.name: Redemption
fields.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, return it to life with 1 Health.
fields.flavortext: I am not sure how you get demptioned the first time.  It’s a mystery!

fields.name: Headcrack
fields.text: Deal $2 damage to the enemy hero. Combo: Return this to your hand next turn.
fields.flavortext: When all else fails, nothing beats a swift whack upside the head.

fields.name: Shadowstep
fields.text: Return a friendly minion to your hand. It_costs (2) less.
fields.flavortext: Rogue dance troops will sometimes Shadowstep away at the end of a performance.  Crowds love it.

fields.name: Preparation
fields.text: The next spell you cast this turn costs (3) less.
fields.flavortext: "Be Prepared" - Rogue Motto

fields.name: Wrath
fields.text: Choose One - Deal $3 damage to a minion; or $1 damage and draw a card.
fields.flavortext: The talk around the Ratchet Inn is that this card is too good and should be a Legendary.

fields.name: Mark of Nature
fields.text: Choose One - Give a minion +4 Attack; or +4 Health and Taunt.
fields.flavortext: Druids call it the "Mark of Nature."  Everyone else calls it "needing a bath."

fields.name: Soul of the Forest
fields.text: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Summon a 2/2 Treant."
fields.flavortext: "Reforestation" is suddenly a terrifying word.

fields.name: Power of the Wild
fields.text: Choose One - Give your minions +1/+1; or Summon a 3/2 Panther.
fields.flavortext: Never look a panther in the eye.  Or is it 'Always look a panther in the eye'?  Well, it's one of those.

fields.name: Naturalize
fields.text:
Destroy a minion.
Your opponent draws 2_cards.
fields.flavortext: Another one bites the dust.

fields.name: Dire Wolf Alpha
fields.text: Adjacent minions have +1_Attack.
fields.flavortext: We are pretty excited about the upcoming release of Dire Wolf Beta, just repost this sign for a chance at a key.

fields.name: Nourish
fields.text: Choose One - Gain 2_Mana Crystals; or Draw 3 cards.
fields.flavortext: Druids take nourishment from many things: the power of nature, the songbird's chirp, a chocolate cake.

fields.name: Druid of the Claw
fields.flavortext: Cat or Bear?  Cat or Bear?!  I just cannot CHOOSE!

fields.name: Keeper of the Grove
fields.text: Choose One - Deal_2_damage; or Silence a minion.
fields.flavortext: These guys just show up and start Keeping your Groves without even asking.

fields.name: Innervate
fields.text: Gain 2 Mana Crystals this turn only.
fields.flavortext: Some druids still have flashbacks from strangers yelling "Innervate me!!" at them.

fields.name: Emperor Cobra
fields.text: Poisonous
fields.flavortext: The Sholazar Basin is home to a lot of really horrible things. If you're going to visit, wear bug spray.  And plate armor.

fields.name: Starfire
fields.text:
Deal $5 damage.
Draw a card.
fields.flavortext: Balance is important to druids.  This card is perfectly balanced.

fields.name: Ancient of War
fields.text: Choose One - +5 Attack; or +5 Health and Taunt.
fields.flavortext: Young Night Elves love to play "Who can get the Ancient of War to Uproot?"  You lose if you get crushed to death.

fields.name: Lightning Bolt
fields.text: Deal $3 damage. Overload: (1)
fields.flavortext: Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt!

fields.name: Lava Burst
fields.text: Deal $5 damage. Overload: (2)
fields.flavortext: It's like an ocean of liquid magma in your mouth!

fields.name: Dust Devil
fields.text: Windfury. Overload: (2)
fields.flavortext: Westfall is full of dust devils. And buzzards. And crazed golems. And pirates. Why does anyone live here?

fields.name: Totemic Might
fields.text: Give your Totems +2_Health.
fields.flavortext: Totem-stomping is no longer recommended.

fields.name: Earth Shock
fields.text: Silence a minion, then deal $1 damage to it.
fields.flavortext: Earth Shock? Shouldn't it be "Azeroth Shock"?

fields.name: Hex
fields.text: Transform a minion into a 0/1 Frog with Taunt.
fields.flavortext: If you Hex a Murloc... it really isn't much of a change, is it?

fields.name: Stormforged Axe
fields.text: Overload: (1)
fields.flavortext: Yo, that's a nice axe.

fields.name: Feral Spirit
fields.text: Summon two 2/3 Spirit Wolves with Taunt. Overload: (2)
fields.flavortext: Spirit wolves are like regular wolves with pom-poms.

fields.name: Baron Geddon
fields.text: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to ALL other characters.
fields.flavortext: Baron Geddon was Ragnaros's foremost lieutenant, until he got FIRED.

fields.name: Earth Elemental
fields.text: Taunt Overload: (3)
fields.flavortext: Nothing beats rock.

fields.name: Forked Lightning
fields.text: Deal $2 damage to 2_random enemy minions. Overload: (2)
fields.flavortext: If you combine it with Spooned Lightning and Knived Lightning, you have the full dining set.

fields.name: Unbound Elemental
fields.text: Whenever you play a card_with Overload, gain_+1/+1.
fields.flavortext: Unlike bound elementals, Unbound ones really enjoy a night on the town.

fields.name: Lightning Storm
fields.text: Deal $2-$3 damage to all_enemy minions. Overload: (2)
fields.flavortext: An umbrella won't be effective, I'm afraid.

fields.name: Ethereal Arcanist
fields.text: If you control a Secret at_the end of your turn, gain +2/+2.
fields.flavortext: The ethereals are wrapped in cloth to give form to their non-corporeal bodies. Also because it's nice and soft.

fields.name: Cone of Cold
fields.text: Freeze a minion and the minions next to it, and deal $1 damage to them.
fields.flavortext: Magi of the Kirin Tor were casting Cubes of Cold for many years before Cones came into fashion some 90 years ago.

fields.name: Arcane Missiles
fields.text: Deal $3 damage randomly split among all enemies.
fields.flavortext: You'd think you'd be able to control your missiles a little better since you're a powerful mage and all.

fields.name: Shiv
fields.text:
Deal $1 damage.
Draw a card.
fields.flavortext: Rogues are experts at SHIV-al-ry.

fields.name: Pyroblast
fields.text: Deal $10 damage.
fields.flavortext: Take the time for an evil laugh after you draw this card.

fields.name: Frost Elemental
fields.text: Battlecry: Freeze a_character.
fields.flavortext: When a Water elemental and an Ice elemental love each other VERY much...

fields.name: Azure Drake
fields.text: Spell Damage +1. Battlecry: Draw a card.
fields.flavortext: They initially planned to be the Beryl or Cerulean drakes, but those felt a tad too pretentious.

fields.name: Counterspell
fields.text: Secret: When your opponent casts a spell, Counter it.
fields.flavortext: What's the difference between a mage playing with Counterspell and a mage who isn't?  The mage who isn't is getting Pyroblasted in the face.

fields.name: Ice Barrier
fields.text: Secret: When your hero is attacked, gain 8 Armor.
fields.flavortext: This is Rank 1.  Rank 2 is Chocolate Milk Barrier.

fields.name: Mirror Entity
fields.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, summon a copy of it.
fields.flavortext: "You go first." - Krush'gor the Behemoth, to his pet boar.

fields.name: Ice Block
fields.text: Secret: When your hero takes fatal damage, prevent it and become Immune this turn.
fields.flavortext: Ice is nice, and will suffice!

fields.name: Ragnaros the Firelord
fields.text: Can't attack. At the end of your turn, deal 8 damage to a random enemy.
fields.flavortext: Ragnaros was summoned by the Dark Iron dwarves, who were eventually enslaved by the Firelord.  Summoning Ragnaros often doesn’t work out the way you want it to.

fields.name: Felguard
fields.text: Taunt Battlecry: Destroy one of your Mana Crystals.
fields.flavortext: Yes, he'll fight for you.  BUT HE'S NOT GOING TO LIKE IT.

fields.name: Mortal Coil
fields.text: Deal $1 damage to a minion. If that kills it, draw a card.
fields.flavortext: If your spells look like horrifying skulls, let's be honest, you should get to draw some cards.

fields.name: Shadowflame
fields.text: Destroy a friendly minion and deal its Attack damage to all enemy minions.
fields.flavortext: Start with a powerful minion and stir in Shadowflame and you have a good time!

fields.name: Void Terror
fields.text: [x]Battlecry: Destroy both adjacent minions and gain their Attack and Health.
fields.flavortext: If you put this into your deck, you WILL lose the trust of your other minions.

fields.name: Succubus
fields.text: Battlecry: Discard a random card.
fields.flavortext: Warlocks have it pretty good.

fields.name: Soulfire
fields.text:
[x]Deal $4 damage.
Discard a random card.
fields.flavortext: Are you lighting a soul on fire? Or burning someone with your OWN soul? This seems like an important distinction.

fields.name: Siphon Soul
fields.text: Destroy a minion. Restore #3 Health to_your hero.
fields.flavortext: You probably should avoid siphoning your own soul.  You might create some kind of weird infinite loop.

fields.name: Doomguard
fields.text: Charge. Battlecry: Discard two random cards.
fields.flavortext: Summoning a doomguard is risky. Someone is going to die.

fields.name: Twisting Nether
fields.text: Destroy all minions.
fields.flavortext: The Twisting Nether is a formless place of magic and illusion and destroyed minions.

fields.name: Pit Lord
fields.text: Battlecry: Deal 5 damage to your hero.
fields.flavortext: Mannoroth, Magtheridon, and Brutallus may be dead, but it turns out there are a LOT of pit lords.

fields.name: Summoning Portal
fields.text: Your minions cost (2) less, but not less than (1).
fields.flavortext: NOT LESS THAN 1!  Don't get any ideas!

fields.name: Power Overwhelming
fields.text: Give a friendly minion +4/+4 until end of turn. Then, it dies. Horribly.
fields.flavortext: We cannot even describe how horrible the death is.  It's CRAZY bad!  Maybe worse than that.  Just don't do it.

fields.name: Sense Demons
fields.text:
Draw 2 Demons
from your deck.
fields.flavortext: Generally demons are pretty obvious and you don’t need a spell to sense them.

fields.name: Flame Imp
fields.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to your hero.
fields.flavortext: Imps like being on fire.  They just do.

fields.name: Bane of Doom
fields.text: Deal $2 damage to_a character. If that kills it, summon a random Demon.
fields.flavortext: My advice to you is to avoid Doom, if possible.

fields.name: Lord Jaraxxus
fields.text: Battlecry: Destroy your hero and replace it with Lord Jaraxxus.
fields.flavortext: "TRIFLING GNOME! YOUR ARROGANCE WILL BE YOUR UNDOING!!!!"

fields.name: Silence
fields.text: Silence a minion.
fields.flavortext: Reserved for enemy spellcasters, evil liches from beyond the grave, and karaoke nights at the Grim Guzzler.

fields.name: Shadow Madness
fields.text: Gain control of an enemy minion with 3 or less Attack until end of turn.
fields.flavortext: You can rationalize it all you want, it's still a mean thing to do.

fields.name: Lightspawn
fields.text: This minion's Attack is always equal to its Health.
fields.flavortext: Spawn of the Light? Or Pawn of the Lights?

fields.name: Thoughtsteal
fields.text: Copy 2 cards in your opponent's deck and add them to your hand.
fields.flavortext: "What do you get when you cast Thoughtsteal on an Orc?  Nothing!" - Tauren joke

fields.name: Lightwell
fields.text: At the start of your turn, restore 3 Health to a damaged friendly character.
fields.flavortext: It isn't clear if people ignore the Lightwell, or if it is just invisible.

fields.name: Mindgames
fields.text:
Put a copy of
a random minion from
your opponent's deck into the battlefield.
fields.flavortext: Sometimes it feels like this is all a game.

fields.name: Divine Favor
fields.text: Draw cards until you have as many in hand as your opponent.
fields.flavortext: This is not just a favor, but a divine one, like helping someone move a couch with a fold out bed!

fields.name: Prophet Velen
fields.text: Double the damage and healing of your spells and Hero Power.
fields.flavortext: He's been exiled from his home, and all his brothers turned evil, but otherwise he doesn't have a lot to complain about.

fields.name: Lay on Hands
fields.text: Restore #8 Health. Draw_3 cards.
fields.flavortext: A grammatically awkward life saver.

fields.name: Blessed Champion
fields.text: Double a minion's Attack.
fields.flavortext: This card causes double the trouble AND double the fun.

fields.name: Humility
fields.text: Change a minion's Attack to 1.
fields.flavortext: This card makes something really damp.  Oh wait.  That's "Humidity."

fields.name: Argent Protector
fields.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Divine Shield.
fields.flavortext: "I'm not saying you can dodge fireballs.  I'm saying with this shield, you won't have to."

fields.name: Blessing of Wisdom
fields.text: Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, draw a card.
fields.flavortext: Apparently with wisdom comes the knowledge that you should probably be attacking every turn.

fields.name: Holy Wrath
fields.text: Draw a card and deal_damage equal to_its Cost.
fields.flavortext: C'mon Molten Giant!!

fields.name: Sword of Justice
fields.text: After you summon a minion, give it +1/+1 and this loses 1_Durability.
fields.flavortext: I dub you Sir Loin of Beef!

fields.name: Hand of Protection
fields.text: Give a minion Divine Shield.
fields.flavortext: This spell has been renamed so many times, even paladins don’t know what it should be called anymore.

fields.name: Repentance
fields.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, reduce its Health to 1.
fields.flavortext: Repentance often comes in the moment before obliteration. Curious.

fields.name: Aldor Peacekeeper
fields.text: Battlecry: Change an_enemy minion's Attack to 1.
fields.flavortext: The Aldor hate two things: the Scryers and smooth jazz.

fields.name: Tirion Fordring
fields.text: Divine Shield. Taunt. Deathrattle: Equip a 5/3_Ashbringer.
fields.flavortext: If you haven't heard the Tirion Fordring theme song, it's because it doesn't exist.

fields.name: Avenging Wrath
fields.text: Deal $8 damage randomly split among all enemies.
fields.flavortext: Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham!

fields.name: Tauren Warrior
fields.text: Taunt Enrage: +3 Attack.
fields.flavortext: Tauren Warrior: Champion of Mulgore, Slayer of Quilboar, Rider of Thunderbluff Elevators.

fields.name: Slam
fields.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it survives, draw a card.
fields.flavortext: "Dun da dun, dun da dun": if you've heard an ogre sing this, it's too late.

fields.name: Battle Rage
fields.text: Draw a card for each damaged friendly character.
fields.flavortext: "You won't like me when I'm angry."

fields.name: Amani Berserker
fields.text: Enrage: +3 Attack
fields.flavortext: If an Amani berserker asks "Joo lookin' at me?!", the correct response is "Nah, mon".

fields.name: Mogu'shan Warden
fields.text: Taunt
fields.flavortext: All these guys ever do is talk about the Thunder King.   BOOOORRRINNG!

fields.name: Arathi Weaponsmith
fields.text: Battlecry: Equip a 2/2_weapon.
fields.flavortext: 50% off fist weapons, limited time only!

fields.name: Gurubashi Berserker
fields.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, gain +3_Attack.
fields.flavortext: No Pain, No Gain.

fields.name: Whirlwind
fields.text: Deal $1 damage to ALL_minions.
fields.flavortext: The way to tell seasoned warriors from novice ones: the novices yell "wheeeee" while whirlwinding.

fields.name: Armorsmith
fields.text: Whenever a friendly minion_takes damage, gain 1 Armor.
fields.flavortext: She accepts guild funds for repairs!

fields.name: Shieldbearer
fields.text: Taunt
fields.flavortext: Have you seen the size of the shields in this game??  This is no easy job.

fields.name: Brawl
fields.text: Destroy all minions except one. (chosen randomly)
fields.flavortext: Do you know the first rule of Brawl Club?

fields.name: Mortal Strike
fields.text: Deal $4 damage. If you have 12 or less Health, deal $6 instead.
fields.flavortext: "If you only use one ability, use Mortal Strike." - The Warrior Code, Line 6

fields.name: Upgrade!
fields.text: If you have a weapon, give it +1/+1. Otherwise equip a 1/3 weapon.
fields.flavortext: Easily worth 50 DKP.

fields.name: Shield Slam
fields.text: Deal 1 damage to a minion for each Armor you have.
fields.flavortext: "What is a better weapon? The sharp one your enemies expect, or the blunt one they ignore?" - The Art of Warrior, Chapter 9

fields.name: Gorehowl
fields.text: Attacking a minion costs 1 Attack instead of 1 Durability.
fields.flavortext: Grommash Hellscream's famous axe.  Somehow this ended up in Prince Malchezaar's possession.  Quite the mystery!

fields.name: Raging Worgen
fields.text: Enrage: Windfury and +1_Attack.
fields.flavortext: If he's raging now, just wait until he gets nerfed.

fields.name: Grommash Hellscream
fields.text: Charge Enrage: +6 Attack
fields.flavortext: Grommash drank the tainted blood of Mannoroth, dooming the orcs to green skin and red eyes!  Maybe not his best decision.

fields.name: Murloc Tidehunter
fields.text: Battlecry: Summon a 1/1_Murloc Scout.
fields.flavortext: "Death will rise, from the tides!"

fields.name: Murloc Warleader
fields.text: Your other Murlocs have +2/+1.
fields.flavortext: Do Murlocs ever get tired of making the same old sound?  Nope!  Mrglglrglglglglglglgl!

fields.name: Grimscale Oracle
fields.text: Your other Murlocs have +1 Attack.
fields.flavortext: These are the brainy murlocs.  It turns out that doesn’t mean much.

fields.name: Murloc Tidecaller
fields.text: Whenever you summon a Murloc, gain +1 Attack.
fields.flavortext: This guy gets crazy strong at family reunions.

fields.name: Patient Assassin
fields.text: Stealth Poisonous
fields.flavortext: He’s not really that patient. It just takes a while for someone to walk by that he can actually reach.

fields.name: Scavenging Hyena
fields.text: Whenever a friendly Beast dies, gain +2/+1.
fields.flavortext: Hyenas prefer the bones of kodos or windserpents, but they'll eat pretty much anything.  Even Brussels sprouts.

fields.name: Misdirection
fields.text: Secret: When an enemy attacks your hero, instead it attacks another random character.
fields.flavortext: Sometimes it's as simple as putting on a fake mustache and pointing at someone else.

fields.name: Savannah Highmane
fields.text: Deathrattle: Summon two 2/2 Hyenas.
fields.flavortext: In the jungle, the mighty jungle, the lion gets slowly consumed by hyenas.

fields.name: Eaglehorn Bow
fields.text: [x]Whenever a friendly Secret is revealed, gain +1 Durability.
fields.flavortext: First Lesson: Put the pointy end in the other guy.

fields.name: Explosive Shot
fields.text: Deal $5 damage to a minion and $2 damage to adjacent ones.
fields.flavortext: Pull the pin, count to 5, then shoot.  Then duck.

fields.name: Unleash the Hounds
fields.text: For each enemy minion, summon a 1/1 Hound with Charge.
fields.flavortext: You must read the name of this card out loud each time you play it.

fields.name: Kill Command
fields.text:
Deal $3 damage. If you control a Beast, deal
$5 damage instead.
fields.flavortext: "Kill!", he commanded.

fields.name: King Krush
fields.text: Charge
fields.flavortext: The best defense against King Krush is to have someone you don’t like standing in front of you.

fields.name: Flare
fields.text: All minions lose Stealth. Destroy all enemy Secrets. Draw a card.
fields.flavortext: Not only does it reveal your enemies, but it's also great for parties!

fields.name: Bestial Wrath
fields.text: Give a friendly Beast +2 Attack and Immune this turn.
fields.flavortext: The seething wrath is just beneath the surface.  Beneath that is wild abandon, followed by slight annoyance.

fields.name: Snake Trap
fields.text: Secret: When one of your minions is attacked, summon three 1/1 Snakes.
fields.flavortext: Why did it have to be snakes?

fields.name: Harvest Golem
fields.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 2/1 Damaged Golem.
fields.flavortext: "Overheat threshold exceeded. System failure. Wheat clog in port two. Shutting down."

fields.name: Nat Pagle
fields.text: At the start of your turn, you have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.
fields.flavortext: Nat Pagle, Azeroth's premier fisherman!  He invented the Auto-Angler 3000, the Extendo-Pole 3000, and the Lure-o-matic 2099 (still in testing).

fields.name: Harrison Jones
fields.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon and draw cards equal to its Durability.
fields.flavortext: “That belongs in the Hall of Explorers!”

fields.name: Archmage Antonidas
fields.text: Whenever you cast a spell, add a 'Fireball' spell to_your hand.
fields.flavortext: Antonidas was the Grand Magus of the Kirin Tor, and Jaina's mentor.  This was a big step up from being Grand Magus of Jelly Donuts.

fields.name: Nozdormu
fields.text: Players only have 15 seconds to take their_turns.
fields.flavortext: Time to write some flavor text.

fields.name: Alexstrasza
fields.text: Battlecry: Set a hero's remaining Health to 15.
fields.flavortext: Alexstrasza the Life-Binder brings life and hope to everyone.  Except Deathwing.  And Malygos.  And Nekros.

fields.name: Onyxia
fields.text: Battlecry: Summon 1/1 Whelps until your side of the battlefield is full.
fields.flavortext: Onyxia long manipulated the Stormwind Court by disguising herself as Lady Katrana Prestor.   You would have thought that the giant wings and scales would have been a giveaway.

fields.name: Malygos
fields.text: Spell Damage +5
fields.flavortext: Malygos hates it when mortals use magic.  He gets so mad!

fields.name: Faceless Manipulator
fields.text: Battlecry: Choose a minion and become a copy of it.
fields.flavortext: The Faceless Ones are servants of Yogg-Saron, and they feed on fear. Right now they are feeding on your fear of accidentally disenchanting all your good cards.

fields.name: Flametongue Totem
fields.text: Adjacent minions have +2_Attack.
fields.flavortext: Totemsmiths like to use the rarest woods for their totems.  There are even rumors of totems made of Ironbark Protectors.

fields.name: Doomhammer
fields.text: Windfury, Overload: (2)
fields.flavortext: Orgrim Doomhammer gave this legendary weapon to Thrall.  His name is a total coincidence.

fields.name: Bite
fields.text: Give your hero +4_Attack this turn. Gain 4 Armor.
fields.flavortext: Chew your food!

fields.name: Force of Nature
fields.text: Summon three 2/2 Treants.
fields.flavortext: "I think I'll just nap under these trees. Wait... AAAAAHHH!" - Blinkfizz, the Unfortunate Gnome

fields.name: Ysera
fields.text: At the end of your turn, add_a Dream Card to_your hand.
fields.flavortext: Ysera rules the Emerald Dream.  Which is some kind of green-mirror-version of the real world, or something?

fields.name: Cenarius
fields.text: Choose One - Give your other minions +2/+2; or Summon two 2/2 Treants with Taunt.
fields.flavortext: Yes, he's a demigod. No, he doesn't need to wear a shirt.

fields.name: Mana Tide Totem
fields.text: At the end of your turn, draw a card.
fields.flavortext: It is said that some shaman can say "Floatin' totem" 10 times, fast.

fields.name: The Beast
fields.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 3/3 Finkle Einhorn for your opponent.
fields.flavortext: He lives in Blackrock Mountain.  He eats Gnomes.  That's pretty much it.

fields.name: Savagery
fields.text: Deal damage equal to your hero's Attack to a minion.
fields.flavortext: It is true that some druids are savage, but others still enjoy a quiet moment and a spot of tea.

fields.name: Sap
fields.text: Return an enemy minion to your opponent's hand.
fields.flavortext: Rogues love sappy movies.

fields.name: Dalaran Mage
fields.text: Spell Damage +1
fields.flavortext: You don't see a lot of Dalaran warriors.

fields.name: Priestess of Elune
fields.text: Battlecry: Restore 4 Health to your hero.
fields.flavortext: If she threatens to "moon" you, it's not what you think.

fields.name: Ancient Mage
fields.text: Battlecry: Give adjacent_minions Spell_Damage +1.
fields.flavortext: Sometimes he forgets and just wanders into someone else's game.

fields.name: Sea Giant
fields.text: Costs (1) less for each other minion on the battlefield.
fields.flavortext: See?  Giant.

fields.name: Windspeaker
fields.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Windfury.
fields.flavortext: Is there anything worse than a Windspeaker with halitosis?

fields.name: Blood Knight
fields.text: Battlecry: All minions lose Divine Shield. Gain +3/+3 for each Shield lost.
fields.flavortext: The Blood Knights get their holy powers from the Sunwell, which you should NOT bathe in.

fields.name: Auchenai Soulpriest
fields.text: Your cards and powers that restore Health now deal damage instead.
fields.flavortext: The Auchenai know the end is coming, but they're not sure when.

fields.name: Nightblade
fields.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to the enemy hero.
fields.flavortext: Your face is the place you'd probably least like a dagger, and where rogues are most likely to deliver them.

fields.name: Vaporize
fields.text: Secret: When a minion attacks your hero, destroy it.
fields.flavortext: Rumor has it that Deathwing brought about the Cataclysm after losing a game to this card.  We may never know the truth.

fields.name: Cult Master
fields.text: Whenever one of your other minions dies, draw a card.
fields.flavortext: She may be an evil cult master, but she still calls her parents once a week.

fields.name: Demonfire
fields.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it’s a friendly Demon, give it +2/+2 instead.
fields.flavortext: Demonfire is like regular fire except for IT NEVER STOPS BURNING HELLLPPP

fields.name: Imp Master
fields.text:
[x]At the end of your turn, deal
1 damage to this minion
 and summon a 1/1 Imp.
fields.flavortext: She would enjoy the job a lot more if she just could get the imps to QUIT BITING HER.

fields.name: Cruel Taskmaster
fields.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to a minion and give it +2_Attack.
fields.flavortext: "I'm going to need you to come in on Sunday." - Cruel Taskmaster

fields.name: Frothing Berserker
fields.text: Whenever a minion takes damage, gain +1 Attack.
fields.flavortext: He used to work as an accountant before he tried his hand at Berserkering.

fields.name: Shield Block
fields.text:
Gain 5 Armor.
Draw a card.
fields.flavortext: Shields were invented because Face Block is USELESS.

fields.name: Inner Rage
fields.text: Deal $1 damage to a minion and give it +2_Attack.
fields.flavortext: They're only smiling on the outside.

fields.name: Sorcerer's Apprentice
fields.text: Your spells cost (1) less.
fields.flavortext: Apprentices are great for bossing around.  "Conjure me some mana buns! And a coffee!  Make that a mana coffee!"

fields.name: Snipe
fields.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, deal $4 damage to it.
fields.flavortext: A great sniper hits the spot.  Just like a delicious flank of boar. Mmmmm.

fields.name: Explosive Trap
fields.text: Secret: When your hero is attacked, deal $2 damage to all enemies.
fields.flavortext: It traps your food AND cooks it for you!

fields.name: Freezing Trap
fields.text: Secret: When an enemy minion attacks, return it to its owner's hand. It costs (2) more.
fields.flavortext: "Dang, that's cold." - appropriate response to Freezing Trap, or a mean joke.

fields.name: Kirin Tor Mage
fields.text: [x]Battlecry: The next Secret you play this turn costs (0).
fields.flavortext: The Kirin Tor reside in the floating city of Dalaran.  How do you make a Dalaran float?  Two scoops of ice cream, one scoop of Dalaran.

fields.name: Edwin VanCleef
fields.text: Combo: Gain +2/+2 for each other card you've played this turn.
fields.flavortext: He led the Stonemasons in the reconstruction of Stormwind, and when the nobles refused to pay, he founded the Defias Brotherhood to, well, deconstruct Stormwind.

fields.name: Illidan Stormrage
fields.text: Whenever you play a card, summon a 2/1 Flame of_Azzinoth.
fields.flavortext: Illidan's brother, Malfurion, imprisoned him beneath Hyjal for 10,000 years.  Stormrages are not good at letting go of grudges.

fields.name: Mana Wraith
fields.text: ALL minions cost (1) more.
fields.flavortext: They come out at night to eat leftover mana crystals. "Mmmmmm," they say.

fields.name: Deadly Shot
fields.text: Destroy a random enemy minion.
fields.flavortext: Accuracy is not a highly valued trait among the mok'nathal.  Deadliness is near the top, though.

fields.name: Equality
fields.text: Change the Health of ALL minions to 1.
fields.flavortext: We are all special unique snowflakes... with 1 Health.

fields.name: Molten Giant
fields.text: Costs (1) less for each damage your hero has taken.
fields.flavortext: He gets terrible heartburn.  BECAUSE HE IS FULL OF LAVA.

fields.name: Circle of Healing
fields.text: Restore #4 Health to ALL_minions.
fields.flavortext: It isn't really a circle.

fields.name: Shadow Word: Death
fields.text: Destroy a minion with 5_or more Attack.
fields.flavortext: If you miss, it leaves a lightning-bolt-shaped scar on your target.

fields.name: Temple Enforcer
fields.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +3 Health.
fields.flavortext: He also moonlights Thursday nights as a bouncer at the Pig and Whistle Tavern.

fields.name: Holy Fire
fields.text: Deal $5 damage. Restore #5 Health to your hero.
fields.flavortext: Often followed by Holy Smokes!

fields.name: Shadowform
fields.text: Your Hero Power becomes 'Deal 2 damage'. If already in Shadowform: 3 damage.
fields.flavortext: If a bright light shines on a priest in Shadowform… do they cast a shadow?

fields.name: Mass Dispel
fields.text: Silence all enemy minions. Draw a card.
fields.flavortext: It dispels buffs, powers, hopes, and dreams.

fields.name: Zombie Chow
fields.text: Deathrattle: Restore 5 Health to the enemy hero.
fields.flavortext: Zombie.  It's what's for dinner.

fields.name: Haunted Creeper
fields.text: Deathrattle: Summon two 1/1 Spectral Spiders.
fields.flavortext: Arachnofauxbia: Fear of fake spiders.

fields.name: Echoing Ooze
fields.text: Battlecry: Summon an exact copy of this minion at the end of the turn.
fields.flavortext: OOZE... Ooze... Ooze... (ooze...)

fields.name: Mad Scientist
fields.text: Deathrattle: Put a Secret from your deck into the battlefield.
fields.flavortext: His mother wanted him to be a mage or a warlock, but noooooooo, he had to go and be a scientist like his father.

fields.name: Shade of Naxxramas
fields.text: Stealth. At the start of your turn, gain +1/+1.
fields.flavortext: The Shades of Naxxramas hate the living. They even have a slur they use to refer them: Livers.

fields.name: Nerubian Egg
fields.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 4/4 Nerubian.
fields.flavortext: Eggs are a good source of protein and Nerubians.

fields.name: Spectral Knight
fields.text: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
fields.flavortext: What do Faerie Dragons and Spectral Knights have in common?  They both love pasta!

fields.name: Deathlord
fields.text: Taunt. Deathrattle: Your opponent puts a minion from their deck into the battlefield.
fields.flavortext: "Rise from your grave!" - Kel'Thuzad

fields.name: Maexxna
fields.text: Poisonous
fields.flavortext: Maexxna gets super mad when people introduce her as "Maxina" or "Maxxy".

fields.name: Webspinner
fields.text: Deathrattle: Add a random Beast card to your hand.
fields.flavortext: Spider cocoons are like little piñatas!

fields.name: Sludge Belcher
fields.text: Taunt Deathrattle: Summon a 1/2 Slime with Taunt.
fields.flavortext: DO NOT GIVE HIM A ROOT BEER.

fields.name: Kel'Thuzad
fields.text: At the end of each turn, summon all friendly minions that died this turn.
fields.flavortext: Kel'Thuzad could not resist the call of the Lich King. Even when it's just a robo-call extolling the Lich King's virtues.

fields.name: Stalagg
fields.text: Deathrattle: If Feugen also died this game, summon Thaddius.
fields.flavortext: Stalagg want to write own flavor text.  "STALAGG AWESOME!"

fields.name: Feugen
fields.text: Deathrattle: If Stalagg also died this game, summon Thaddius.
fields.flavortext: Feugen is sad because everyone likes Stalagg better.

fields.name: Wailing Soul
fields.text: Battlecry: Silence your other minions.
fields.flavortext: This soul just wails on you. Dang, soul, let up already.

fields.name: Nerub'ar Weblord
fields.text: Minions with Battlecry cost (2) more.
fields.flavortext: Weblords spend all day making giant trampoline parks.

fields.name: Duplicate
fields.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, put 2 copies of it into your hand.
fields.flavortext: The one time when duping cards won't get your account banned!

fields.name: Poison Seeds
fields.text: Destroy all minions and summon 2/2 Treants to replace them.
fields.flavortext: "Poisonseed Bagel" is the least popular bagel at McTiggin's Druidic Bagel Emporium.

fields.name: Avenge
fields.text: Secret: When one of your minions dies, give a random friendly minion +3/+2.
fields.flavortext: Several paladins have joined together to deliver justice under the name "Justice Force".  Their lawyer talked them out of calling themselves the Justice League.

fields.name: Death's Bite
fields.text: Deathrattle: Deal 1 damage to all minions.
fields.flavortext: "Take a bite outta Death." - McScruff the Deathlord

fields.name: Voidcaller
fields.text: Deathrattle: Put a random Demon from your hand into the battlefield.
fields.flavortext: "Void!  Here, void!  Here, buddy!"

fields.name: Dark Cultist
fields.text: Deathrattle: Give a random friendly minion +3 Health.
fields.flavortext: The Cult of the Damned has found it's best not to mention their name when recruiting new cultists.

fields.name: Unstable Ghoul
fields.text: Taunt. Deathrattle: Deal 1 damage to all minions.
fields.flavortext: Filling your Ghouls with Rocket Fuel is all the rage at Necromancer school.

fields.name: Reincarnate
fields.text: Destroy a minion, then return it to life with full Health.
fields.flavortext: It's like birth, except you're an adult and you were just dead a second ago.

fields.name: Anub'ar Ambusher
fields.text: Deathrattle: Return a random friendly minion to your hand.
fields.flavortext: Originally he was called "Anub'ar Guy who bounces a guy back to your hand", but it lacked a certain zing.

fields.name: Stoneskin Gargoyle
fields.text: At the start of your turn, restore this minion to full Health.
fields.flavortext: Stoneskin Gargoyles love freeze tag.

fields.name: Undertaker
fields.text: Whenever you summon a minion with Deathrattle, gain +1 Attack.
fields.flavortext: In a world where you can run to a spirit healer and resurrect yourself, Undertakers do pretty light business.

fields.name: Loatheb
fields.text: Battlecry: Enemy spells cost (5) more next turn.

fields.name: Unstable Portal
fields.text: Add a random minion to your hand. It costs (3) less.

fields.name: Goblin Blastmage

fields.name: Echo of Medivh

fields.name: Mechwarper

fields.name: Flame Leviathan

fields.name: Lightbomb

fields.name: Velen's Chosen

0110100001101001

fields.title: The 2017 HCT World Championship Is Headed to Amsterdam!
fields.article:
The Hearthstone® Championship Tour (HCT) will come to a star-studded conclusion in Amsterdam as HCT 2017 finishes its journey in the Beurs van Berlage Conference Centre.

This monumental venue once housed the Dutch stock exchange, and has witnessed royal marriages. Now, one of the Netherlands’ most famous buildings will host the HCT World Championship.

fields.title: World Championship Results
fields.article: HCT 2017 came to an epic conclusion this past weekend, when 16 of this years best competitor collided in Amsterdam to be crowned new world championship. With many swings and turns it came down to Americas vs Asia-Pacific finals - Fr0zen vs Tom60229. Fr0zen took solid lead, needing just one more win to finish it all, but Tom was able to clutch it in the end, winning three straight games, and becoming Hearthstone 2017 World Champion!
fields.tags: HCT, World Championship, Fr0zen, Tom60229, finals, Amsterdam
